Sentence.sentence: Asked what they would like to change in the world, the students mentioned only personal concerns such as slowing down the pace of life, gaining good friends, becoming more spiritual, becoming either more materially successful or less materially oriented ( ' , depending on the student's values), and being more respectful of the Earth, animals and other people.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The market demand for electronic devices is now either declining or not growing as fast as before.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: There are more than 600,000 professional social workers in the country, and we all either have a bachelor’s degree, a master’s degree or a Ph D in social work.

Sentence.sentence: But more privileged students must not waste this opportunity either.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Viewed from scientists’ standpoint, allthe energy contained in fuel either now or in the future becomes heat.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Automation isn't just affecting factory workers, either.

Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But the requirements of either of the Acts may be difficult to meet.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: In your behavior, you can either be an actor

Sentence.sentence: Some day you may be either a speaker or a listener in a situation involving people from other countries or members of minority group in North America.

Sentence.sentence: He can't resist the temptation of TV either
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Either a college major is worth its cost or it isn't.

Sentence.sentence: Either way, taxpayers have no business paying for students' college education.

Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.word_list: also, too, as well, either, likewise
means: also ：比too正式一些，语气较重，只用于肯定句，一般紧靠动词。
too ：语气较轻，多用于口语，在肯定句中使用，通常位于句末。
as well ：一般不用否定句，通常放在句末，强调时可放在句中。
either ：用于否定句，放在句末，之前加逗号。

sentences.en: Either of the plans is equally dangerous.
sentences.cn: 这两个计划中, 哪一个都同样有危险。

sentences.en: The news did not shock either of them.
sentences.cn: 这消息没有使他们任何一个人震惊。

sentences.en: I don't think either of them are at home.
sentences.cn: 我想他们中任何一个都不在家。

sentences.en: I have bought two books, you can have either.
sentences.cn: 我买了两本书, 你要哪一本都可以。

sentences.en: You may use either computer.
sentences.cn: 两台计算机你可以随便用一台。

sentences.en: He could write with either hand.
sentences.cn: 他左右手都能写字。

sentences.en: He won't go and I won't go either.
sentences.cn: 他不去, 我也不去。

sentences.en: The product is of high quality and is not expensive either.
sentences.cn: 这种产品质量好价格也不贵。

sentences.en: Tom has no home, or friends either.
sentences.cn: 汤姆没有家, 也没有朋友。

sentences.en: Either your watches or mine is wrong.
sentences.cn: 不是你们的表不准, 就是我的表不准。

sentences.en: I have not been to either Paris or Rome.
sentences.cn: 我既没有到过巴黎也没有到过罗马。

means.word_mean: [用于否定句或否定词组后]也(不…)，亦，而且
[口语] [用于否定句或否定词组后以加强语气]根本；当然；一定
[用于疑问句或条件从句中选择部分后加强语气]
非此即彼的, 两者择一的
[通常用于“either…or…”结构中]或者，要么[在“either…or…”结构中，动词的人称和数一般与离得最近的主动响应；但有时用第三人称单数；在口语中也有把两个主语合在一起用作复数的]</seg>

data.mean: （对两事物的选择）要么…要么，不是…就是

sentence.cn: 为学生提供早餐，晚餐以及熟食或外带午餐（包括三明治，饮料和甜点）。
sentence.en: Students are provided with breakfast,  dinner and either a cooked or packed lunch(which consists of a sandwich,  a drink and a dessert).
sentence.from: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

sentence.cn: 建筑物所有者面临一个选择：要么将其建筑物的第一层更改为地下室，然后将第二层更改为主要楼层，要么将整个建筑物吊起以适应新的街道水平。
sentence.en: Building owners were faced with a choice: either change the first floors of their buildings into basements,  and the second stories into main floors,  or hoist the entire buildings to meet the new street level.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

expand_knowledge_list.cn: 辨析：also用于肯定句句尾，either用于否定句句尾，表示“也”

jx.jx_en_mean: whichever of two given alternatives is the case
jx.jx_cn_mean: 无论是（两者中的）哪种情况，（两种情况）无论何者为实

lj.lj_ly: I'm not sure whether he is trying to be clever or controversial, but either way, such writing smacks of racism.
lj.lj_ls: 我不知道他是想显示自己聪明还是想引起争论，但不管怎样，这样的文章打击了种族主义。

entry.def: You use either in front of the first of two or more alternatives, when you are stating the only possibilities or choices that there are. The other alternatives are introduced by 'or'.
entry.tran: （表示在两者或多者中择其一）或者，要么

example.ex: They gave money to the Conservative Party either personally or through their companies...
example.tran: 他们要么以个人名义要么通过他们的公司捐钱给了保守党。

example.ex: Sightseeing is best done either by tour bus or by bicycles...
example.tran: 最好是乘坐旅游巴士或骑自行车观光。

entry.def: You use either in a negative statement in front of the first of two alternatives to indicate that the negative statement refers to both the alternatives.
entry.tran: （用于否定句中）两者都（不），既（不）

example.ex: ...music that fails to be either funny or funky...
example.tran: 既无趣又没有强烈节奏的音乐

example.ex: There had been no indication of either breathlessness or any loss of mental faculties right until his death.
example.tran: 他去世前并未出现呼吸困难或意识不清的迹象。

entry.def: You can use either to refer to one of two things, people, or situations, when you want to say that they are both possible and it does not matter which one is chosen or considered.

example.ex: There were glasses of champagne and cigars, but not many of either were consumed...
example.tran: 这里有香槟和雪茄，但两样东西都没怎么动。

example.ex: If either were killed, delicate negotiations would be seriously disrupted.
example.tran: 二人中任意一个遇害，都会严重扰乱本已非常棘手的谈判。

entry.def: You use either in a negative statement to refer to each of two things, people, or situations to indicate that the negative statement includes both of them.

example.ex: She warned me that I'd never marry or have children.—'I don't want either.'
example.tran: 她告诫我千万不要结婚，也别要孩子。——“这两样我都不想要。”

entry.def: You use either by itself in negative statements to indicate that there is a similarity or connection with a person or thing that you have just mentioned.

example.ex: He did not even say anything to her, and she did not speak to him either...
example.tran: 他甚至一句话也没跟她说，她也没跟他说话。

example.ex: 'I'm afraid I've never been there.'—'Well, of course, I haven't myself either.'
example.tran: “恐怕我没去过那里。”——“嗯，那当然，我也没有去过。”

entry.def: When one negative statement follows another, you can use either at the end of the second one to indicate that you are adding an extra piece of information, and to emphasize that both are equally important.
entry.tran: （用于两个连续否定句的第二句之后，强调两种观点同样重要）而且，还

example.ex: Don't agree, but don't argue either...
I can't manage that by myself and I don't see why it should be expected of me either.
example.tran: 我一个人没法做那事，我也不明白为什么得要我去做。

entry.def: You can use either to introduce a noun that refers to each of two things when you are talking about both of them.

example.ex: The basketball nets hung down from the ceiling at either end of the gymnasium...
example.tran: 篮筐分别从体育馆两头的天花板上悬吊下来。

example.ex: I suddenly realized that I didn't have a single intelligent thing to say about either team.
example.tran: 我突然意识到我对两队都没有一句称得上有见地的话可讲。

means.word_mean: 1. after a negative statement used as an intensive meaning something like `likewise' or `also';

sentences.sentence: "he isn't stupid, but he isn't exactly a genius either"
"if you don't order dessert I won't either"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ǣgther, contracted form of ǣg(e)hwæther, of Germanic origin; ultimately related to aye and whether

sentences.cn: 要么你自己做这活,要么我们把它留到明天.
sentences.en: Either you do the work all by yourself or we leave it till tomorrow.

sentences.cn: 迪克要么刻苦学习,要么根本不学, 从不走中间路线.
sentences.en: Dick either studies very hard or not at all, never anything in between.

sentences.cn: 你要么现在就伏法认罪, 否则后果自负)?
sentences.en: You either plead guilty now, or suffer the consequences.

sentences.cn: 伟大作家要么是丈夫要么是情人.
sentences.en: Great writers are either husbands or lovers.

sentences.cn: 熊皮厚, 单练的时候不错, 下副本要么是恐龙, 要么是豹子!
sentences.en: Bear bark thickness, Danlian a good time, the next copy of either the dinosaurs, either leopard!

sentences.cn: 你必须要么使默认数据库使用或避免使用特定的数据库.
sentences.en: You need to either make default database accessible or avoid using that particular database.

sentences.cn: 市场就是这么运行的,这些家伙要么是运气不好,要么是太笨了.
sentences.en: This is just how the market works and these guys were either unlucky or stupid.

sentences.cn: 在回答这些问题的过程中,我要么就点头,要么就发出奇怪的叫声.
sentences.en: In answer to these questions I either nodded or made strange noises.

sentences.cn: 促使我们改变的原因只有两个, 要么激励,要么绝望.
sentences.en: We change for two and two reasons only, either inspiration or desperation.

sentences.cn: 患者要么病情轻微,要么就病得很重,需要强效的重症护理.
sentences.en: Patients are either mildly ill or critically ill and require aggressive ICU care.

sentences.cn: 这次危机过后,病人要么死掉,要么好转.
sentences.en: After the crisis the patient either dies or gets better.

sentences.cn: 今天对我们生死攸关,我们要么团结奋斗,要么分崩离析.
sentences.en: Either we heal as a team or we're gonna crumble.

sentences.cn: 直到此时, 之前所有在信经中提到的事要么是看不见的,要么是历史久远的.
sentences.en: Up until this point, everything in the Creed has been either invisible or distantly historical.

sentences.cn: 但是,每个必然的事物要么具有被另一事物所引起的必然性, 要么则不然.
sentences.en: But every necessary thing either has its necessity caused by another, or not.

sentences.cn: 前任的总统要求,要么审判他,要么释放他.
sentences.en: The former president was demanding that he should be either put on trial or set free?

sentences.cn: 詹宁斯先生,要么我们处理这个案件,要么你处理.
sentences.en: Mr. Jennings either we manage this case or you manage it.

sentences.cn: 当这种模式受到挑战,要么被抛弃,要么思想就制造出另一种安全模式.
sentences.en: When that pattern is challenged either it is disregarded or thought creates another pattern of security.

sentences.cn: 要么你尽心尽力,否则我们就把你替换掉.
sentences.en: Either you pull your weight or we replace you.

sentences.cn: 要么是蒂姆要是是他弟弟得去铲雪.
sentences.en: Either Tim or his brother has to shovel snow.

sentences.cn: 我们要么把会议推迟,要么把会议取消.
sentences.en: We could either put off the meeting or cancel it.

sentences.cn: 大多数的情人卡要么上面有一颗心,要么非常粗俗.
sentences.en: Most of the valentine cards either had hearts on them or were very rude.

sentences.cn: 如果我得到斜面要么, 我真的尝试.
sentences.en: And if I cant get either, I really try.

sentences.cn: 他要么是疯了,要么是喝醉了.
sentences.en: He must be either mad or drunk.

Sentence.sentence: Either way, we have choices about how we respond to it when it comes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Almost half of those surveyed said their companies were either in the middle of restructuring or about to embark on ( ' ,  开始) it; and for the most part, restructuring meant putting more emphasis on teams.

Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Born the 16th child to poor parents in Paris in either 1783 or 1784, a young Careme was suddenly abandoned at the height of the French Revolution.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Most urban Africans work for a small minority of the rich, who tend to be involved in either cronyish businesses or politics.

Sentence.sentence: My grandfather and father did not have much capital and our customers didn't have much money, either.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: On top of that, it never really storms in Seattle, either.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Police eventually trapped the cow between two vehicles parked on either side of a baseball field's bench area.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Some colleges have what they call an "honor code", though if you are smart enough to get into these schools, you are either smart enough to get around any codes or hopefully, too ethical to consider doing so.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: To find out, researchers gave 11 volunteer cyclists a carbohydrate solution either with a moderate dose of caffeine,  which is known to stimulate the central nervous system, or as a placebo without, during 3 hours of cycling.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月四级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: We found that the number of bacteria transferred to either kind of food didn't depend much on how long the food was in contact with the contaminated surface——whether for a few seconds or for a whole minute.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月四级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B
